page.title: 17COURT FARM, LANGRIDGE CONT.
page.content: The chief corn crop of the area is barley as wheat requires a more fertile soil, for the same reason oil seed rape is not grown. Swedes and turnips are grown as cattle fodder for the 75 cattle.Their dairy herd was replaced by sheep 6 years ago. They have 80 ewes,mainly Suffolk Cross which this year produced l40 lambs. Mr.Bowyer and his son Mr.G.Bowyer farm the land and employ no permanent staff .Mr.G.Bowyer goes to Chippenham Market on a Friday when necessary. Mrs.Bowyer Senior, used to help with calves and milking,but Mrs.G.Bowyer has her own career outside the farm.A few chickens and a house cow are kept for the needs of both families.They have one sheep dog,3 tractors and one combine.Farm cottages are no longer agricultural dwellings,and now provide homes for people working in Bath.
